classFeature.name: Exploration Knacks
entries: For a ranger exploration isn't just something that happens between destinations - it's a way of life. You start with two ranger {@filter exploration knacks|optionalfeatures|feature type=ek} of your choice. The Knacks Known column of the Ranger table shows when you learn more exploration knacks.

classFeature.name: Familiar Terrain
entries: When making an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to a natural terrain, you gain an expertise die if using a skill you're proficient in. This affects the Chronicle, Gather Components, Harvest, Scout, and Seek Shelter journey activities, but no others. While traveling in a natural terrain, you gain the following benefits:

items: Difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel.
Your group can't become lost except by magical means.
Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling, you remain alert to danger. Your Perception for the purposes of avoiding ambushes increases by 2.
If you are traveling alone, you can move stealthily at a normal pace. This grants you advantage on Scout journey activity checks.
When you take the Harvest journey activity, you gain double the number of perk points you would usually acquire.
While tracking other creatures, you also learn their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

classFeature.name: Studied Adversary
entries: You have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even communicating with your enemies. Choose a type of adversary: aberrations, beasts, celestials, constructs, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, giants, monstrosities, oozes, plants, or undead. Alternatively, you can select two humanoid races as studied adversaries.

You have advantage on Survival checks to track your studied adversaries, as well as on ability checks to recall information about them. You also learn to communicate with basic words in a language of your choice that is spoken by your studied adversaries, if they speak one at all.
During a long rest, you can replace a current studied adversary with a new one.

classFeature.name: Combat Maneuvers
entries: At 2nd level, you gain the ability to use combat maneuvers. You gain proficiency in two combat traditions from the following list: {@filter Biting Zephyr|spells|Subschool=biting zephyr|}, {@filter Mirror's Glint|spells|Subschool=mirror's glint|}, {@filter Rapid Current|spells|Subschool=rapid current|}, {@filter Razor's Edge|spells|Subschool=razor's edge|}, {@filter Spirited Steed|spells|Subschool=spirited steed|}, and {@filter Unending Wheel|spells|Subschool=unending wheel|}. You can learn two maneuvers of your choice from traditions you are proficient with.

You gain an exertion pool equal to twice your proficiency bonus, regaining any spent exertion at the end of a short or long rest. You use your maneuvers by spending points from your exertion pool. The Manuevers Known column of the Ranger table shows when you learn more maneuvers from a tradition you are proficient with, while the Maneuver Degree column shows the highest degree you can select maneuvers from at a given level.

Additionally, whenever you take a long rest, you can choose any number of the maneuvers you know and replace them with the same number of other maneuvers of the same degree from a tradition you are proficient with.

classFeature.name: Stride and Seek
entries: Your wilderness survival instincts guide your physical and mental training. You gain one of the following features at 2nd level. You gain the other feature when you reach 5th level in this class.

entries.name: Hunter's Target
entries: You can use your bonus action to focus your attention on a specific enemy. Choose a creature you can see within 90 feet to mark as your quarry. For 1 hour, you are focused on this creature. You gain a +1 bonus to weapon armour attack rolls against the creature, and your weapon armour attacks against it deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage. In addition, you have advantage on Perception and Survival checks you make to find it. If the creature drops to 0 hit points before the hour ends, you can use a bonus action to mark a new quarry.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Swift Feet
entries: You can use your bonus action to move with greater agility. For 1 minute, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. You can choose to end this effect early to either increase your Speed by 30 feet until the end of your turn or gain advantage on a weapon armour attack.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Stride and Seek (2)
entries: You gain the other feature from your Stride and Seek feature.

classFeature.name: Trained Accuracy
entries: At 2nd level, you learn to maintain a level of discipline that spills over into everything you do. This perpetual state of focus allows you to perform incredible feats. You gain both of the following features.

entries.name: Accuracy Bonus
entries: When you make a weapon armour attack, you can use your reaction to gain an attack bonus or damage bonus as shown on the Accuracy Bonus table. Between long rests, you have a number of uses equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1).

entries.caption: Accuracy Bonus
rows: +1 to hit or +1d6 damage
1 use
+2 to hit or +3d6 damage
2 uses
+3 to hit or +5d6 damage
3 uses

entries.name: Accuracy Reserve
entries: If you have not moved since the beginning of your last turn, you gain a +1 bonus to weapon armour attack rolls until the end of your turn. You lose this bonus if you move.

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 1st level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 3rd level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 5th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 7th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: First Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 9th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your first subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 1
entries: At 11th level, you gain the tier 1 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 2
entries: At 13th level, you gain the tier 2 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 3
entries: At 15th level, you gain the tier 3 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 4
entries: At 17th level, you gain the tier 4 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Second Subclass Tier 5
entries: At 19th level, you gain the tier 5 feature from your second subclass

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increases two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature. Additionally, you gain a feat.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increases two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increases two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increases two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increases two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Wilderness Mystique
entries: At 4th level your experience as an expert survivalist manifests at the subconscious level. Choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Answering Silence
entries: When others seek your advice on wilderness matters, they often arrive at the correct conclusion despite (or perhaps because of) the silence with which you respond. When a friendly creature makes a Nature or Survival check while adjacent to you, it gains an expertise die. This affects their journey activities.

entries.name: Fearsome Mysticism
entries: Your uncanny abilities and single-minded focus can be unnerving to the uninitiated. You gain an expertise die on Intimidation checks against any creature that is neither proficient in Arcana nor casts spells. This affects the Rob journey activity.

entries.name: Kindred Spirit
entries: You intuitively sense when another wilderness expert is nearby. Your Perception for the purposes of detecting hidden or invisible creatures within 30 feet of you increases by 5, and you instantly detect whether any creature you can see is proficient with Stealth or Survival.

classFeature.name: Empowered Attack
entries: From 5th level, when you use the Attack action, your main hand weapon's base damage is doubled. For example, a weapon with a damage of {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier deals {@dice 2d6} + double your Strength modifier instead.

classFeature.name: Adversarial Focus
entries: At 6th level you gain an additional studied adversary, and you gain a +1 bonus to weapon armour attack rolls made against your studied adversaries.

classFeature.name: Game Hunting
entries: At 6th level, you have advantage on Gather Component journey activity checks.
Additionally, being adjacent to a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls with a net.

classFeature.name: Explorer's Instinct
entries: At 8th level, once between long rests, you can take two reactions in a round instead of one.

In addition, whenever you learn a new ranger exploration knack or replace an existing one, you can choose from druid {@filter secrets of nature|optionalfeatures|feature type=sn} or fighter {@filter soldiering knacks|optionalfeatures|feature type=sk}.

classFeature.name: Flash of Steel
entries: At 9th level you gain the {@spell Missile Volley|sns} or {@spell Whirlind Strike|sns} combat maneuver. It does not count against your number of maneuvers known and you do not have to spend exertion points to activate it.

classFeature.name: Hunter's Focus
entries: At 9th level, you can remain focused on your Hunter's Target for up to 8 hours.

classFeature.name: Trackless Hunting
entries: At 10th level, you can't be tracked except by magical means, unless you choose to leave a trail.
In addition, whenever you learn a new ranger exploration knack or replace an existing one, you can choose to learn a {@filter rogue skill trick|optionalfeatures|feature type=st} instead.

classFeature.name: Wilderness Lore
entries: At 12th level, your knowledge of wilderness lore deepens. Choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Big Game Traps
entries: Leveraging your skill with snaring small game, you take 10 minutes to set a trap or snare for a creature of Large size or smaller.
The Trap's DC is 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus. A creature can spot the trap by making a Perception check against the trap's DC.
Describe the mechanics of your trap to the DM, including what triggers it and what happens when triggered. You may use the following examples or work with the DM to invent your own.
When a creature enters the trapped area or interacts with the trapped object it makes a save or triggers the trap.

items.name: Pendulum Trap
entries: Creatures adjacent to the trap are struck by a swinging object that deals bludeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (determined by the object) equal to 1d8 plus your Wisdom modifier.

items.name: Pit Trap
entries: The creature falls into a pre-existing pit or hazard that you have concealed.

items.name: Rope Trap
entries: The creature is either knocked {@condition prone|sns} or {@condition restrained|sns} by a net or rope.

entries.name: Waste Not
entries: With 10 minutes work you can scavenge valuable cuts from the corpse of a beast, dragon, monstrosity, or plant that has a CR of 1 or higher and has died within the last hour. If sold to a collector, druid, or other naturalist, this notable component is worth an amount of gold equal to 5 x the creature's CR (consult your DM to confirm this gold value).

classFeature.name: Guarded Post
entries: Experience has taught you that defending others is often the key to survival. At 13th level choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Defensive Marksman
entries: When a hostile creature moves towards you or an ally, you can use your reaction to make a ranged weapon attack against it.

entries.name: Hunter's Blind
entries: You can spend 10 minutes constructing a natural shelter able to accommodate you. The shelter blends in with its surroundings, and as long as you don't move into or out of it, the shelter is indistinguishable from a natural object. It is designed to allow you to see out while inside, but prevent anyone outside from seeing in.
The shelter is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside, and counts as a Haven for you. Any other creature that tries to use your Hunter's Blind inadvertantly ruins it after 2d4 hours.

classFeature.name: Tactical Advantage
entries: At 14th level you gain a third studied adversary. In addition, you can choose one of the following ranger tactics:

entries.name: Covered Shot
entries: When you are protected by half cover, you gain the benefits of three-quarters cover.

entries.name: Nature's Shadow
entries: You gain an expertise die on Stealth checks.

classFeature.name: Survivalcraft
entries: At 16th level, basic survival skills have become second nature to you. Choose one of the following options:

entries.name: Under the Stars
entries: You gain the benefits of a long rest in half the normal amount of time.

entries.name: Woodlore
entries: Using your action, you can produce a flame at a moment's notice even in wet or cold environments. This allows you to ignore the penalties of wet or cold weather on your journey activities. You can hold the flame in your hand without harming yourself or your equipment. Without additional fuel, the flame lasts for 10 minutes, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

classFeature.name: Hunter's Intent
entries: At 17th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you inflict with a weapon armour attack.

classFeature.name: Flora and Fauna
entries: At 18th level choose one of the following benefits:

entries.name: Beastly Attack
entries: Once on each of your turns, a beast that is friendly to you and able to see or hear you can use its reaction to make a single basic weapon attack.

entries.name: High Ground
entries: You instantly analyse the natural foliage and features of a given terrain as well as how to leverage them to your advantage. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your walking and climbing speeds increase by 5 feet.
When you are protected by three-quarters cover, you gain the benefits of total cover.
If you make a weapon armour attack against a creature, your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks from it until the beginning of your next turn.

When you move through an area, you can cause it to become difficult terrain until the beginning of your next turn, and any creature that moves through the area during that time has disadvantage on its next attack roll.

classFeature.name: Extreme Exploration
entries: Your travels and training have taken you to new heights and amazing depths. At 19th level, you gain two of the following benefits:

items: You gain 50% resistance to fire and cold damage.
You gain immunity to poison.
You gain a swimming speed and climbing speed equal to your Speed.

classFeature.name: Nature's Scion
entries: At 20th level, you are a master of yourself and your natural surroundings. You become extremely familiar with all types of terrain and can use the {@optfeature Master Tracker|sns} exploration knack at will.
In addition, you learn Primordial if you don't already know it and gain one of the following:

entries.name: Elemental Mastery
entries: By focusing on a specific natural element within 100 feet (air, fire, earth, water, or wood) you can attract similar essences to you. After 10 minutes of concentration, a creature of that element is drawn to your presence and becomes your loyal minion (despite not requiring concentration). This creature is based on a level 7 generic minion (https://homebrewery.naturalcrit.com/share/4FjimI1VqkgS), but with the following modifications:

items: The guardian speaks Primordial.
If the guardian is a fire guardian, its Melee attack deals fire damage. Otherwise, it deals bludgeoning damage.
If the guardian's Melee attack hits a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled|sns}, and the guardian uses its Engulf action on it.

The guardian gains the Engulf action: The guardian engulfs a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled|sns} by it. The engulfed creature is {@condition blinded|sns}, {@condition restrained|sns}, and unable to breathe, and at the start of each of the guardian's turns it makes a save or takes 2d8 + 4 bludgeoning DoT damage (or fire for a fire guardian). If the guardian moves, the engulfed creature moves with it. The guardian can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

The guardian gains the Guard Life action: The guardian uses its Engulf on a willing, {@condition unconscious|sns}, or {@condition incapacitated|sns} ally without dealing damage. While engulfed, the ally is {@condition grappled|sns} but not {@condition restrained|sns}, can see and breathe normally, and has total cover. As soon as the ally takes an action, reaction, or bonus action, they are no longer engulfed. The guardian can release the ally at will (no action required).

entries: The creature is friendly to you and your companions, takes its turn immediately after yours, and obeys your verbal commands. The creature disappears after 1 hour, when it is reduced to 0 hit point, or you use a bonus action to dismiss it. Once you have used this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Summon Stampede
entries: You can spend an action speaking directly to the spirit of nature itself to request assistance. All beasts within a 1-mile radius of you are friendly to you for 1 minute, and for the duration on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), you can choose one of the following effects. You can't use the same effect two rounds in a row. Once you have used this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

items: Enraged Fauna: Up to 3 Huge native creatures of up to CR 8 charge forward (use CR 8 generic minions - https://homebrewery.naturalcrit.com/share/4FjimI1VqkgS), bowling into your enemies. Choose any number of creatures you can see within 100 feet. Make a fortitude attack against each of them dealing 9d6 bludgeoning weapon damage. In addition, you can choose one of the Huge creatures to stay and fight. You can have only one such creature assist in this way at a time, and it retreats when bloodied or when you command it to leave. It counts as a minion, despite not requiring concentration.

Rushing Stamped: A Huge-sized horde of Small, Medium, and Large native creatures hurry through the area, traveling in a 30'-wide line from a direction you choose. Until the start of your next turn, the area is difficult terrain. In addition, make a reflex attack against each creature of your choice in the area that deals 5d8 bludgeoning weapon damage. On a hit, a target is knocked {@condition prone|sns} and {@condition debilitated|sns} until the start of your next turn. Otherwise, a target is {@condition rattled|sns} until the start of your next turn.

Swarming Pests: Several Medium-sized swarms of Tiny native creatures enter the spaces of up to 5 Small, Medium, or Large creatures you choose, or the space of a Huge or Gargantuan creature. Make a fortitude attack against each enemy creature in the swarm's area with the following outcomes:

items.name: Minor success
entries: The target is {@condition slowed|sns} until the start of your next turn.

items.name: Standard success
entries: The target becomes {@condition blinded|sns} and {@condition slowed|sns} until the start of your next turn, and loses concentration on any effect it is concentrating on.

items.name: Critical success
entries: As standard success, but the conditions last for 2 rounds instead.

subclassFeature.name: Beast Master
entries: The Beast Master archetype embodies a friendship between the civilized races and the beasts of the world. United in focus, beast and ranger work as one to fight the monstrous foes that threaten civilization and the wilderness alike. Emulating the Beast Master archetype means committing yourself to this ideal, working in partnership with an animal as its companion and friend.

subclassFeature.name: Ranger's Companion
entries: You gain a beast companion that accompanies you on your adventures and is trained to fight alongside you. Choose a {@filter beast that is no larger than Medium and that has a challenge rating of 1/4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=beast|size=f;d;t;s;m|miscellaneous=!swarm}. Add your proficiency bonus to the beast's AC, attack rolls, and damage rolls, as well as to any saving throws and skills it is proficient in. Its hit point maximum equals its normal maximum or four times your ranger level, whichever is higher. Like any creature, the beast can spend Hit Dice during a short rest.

The beast obeys your commands as best as it can. It takes its turn on your initiative. On your turn, you can verbally command the beast where to move (no action required by you). You can use your action to verbally command it to take the {@action Attack}, {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Help} action. If you don't issue a command, the beast takes the {@action Dodge} action. Once you have the Extra Attack feature, you can make one weapon attack yourself when you command the beast to take the {@action Attack} action.

If you are {@condition incapacitated} or absent, your beast companion acts on its own, focusing on protecting you and itself. It never requires your command to use its reaction, such as when making an opportunity attack.
While traveling through your favored terrain with only the beast, you can move stealthily at a normal pace.
If the beast dies, you can obtain another one by spending 8 hours magically bonding with another beast that isn't hostile to you, either the same type of beast as before or a different one.

subclassFeature.name: Exceptional Training
entries: Beginning at 7th level, on any of your turns when your beast companion doesn't attack, you can use a bonus action to command the beast to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Help} action on its turn. In addition, the beast's attacks now count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Fury
entries: Starting at 11th level, when you command your beast companion to take the {@action Attack} action, the beast can make two attacks, or it can take the Multiattack action if it has that action.

subclassFeature.name: Share Spells
entries: Beginning at 15th level, when you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your beast companion with the spell if the beast is within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Beast Friend
entries: After a Befriend Animal journey activity, you can befriend and feed a Medium or smaller beast of your choice, becoming its guardian ranger (use the CR 1/8 generic minion - https://homebrewery.naturalcrit.com/share/4FjimI1VqkgS). It counts as a minion despite not requiring concentration. The beast won't attack except as a response to being attacked, but it can take other actions as normal and makes death saving throws. You can only be a guardian ranger to one beast at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Build Shelter
entries: You can change a failure on a Seek Shelter journey activity check into a success.
Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again for a week.

optionalfeature.name: Calls of the Wild
entries: Using verbal and nonverbal cues to communicate with beasts, you can gain basic information from them or make a simple request (like delivering a shrot message or small object).

optionalfeature.name: Ear to the Ground
entries: By expending 1 minute remaining stationary, using sound a vibrations alone, until you move or take an action you are able to deduce information for up to 30' in every direction, as if using blindsight or tremorsense.

optionalfeature.name: Expert Foraging
entries: After a Harvest journey activity, you can collect a number of edible, non-poisonous plants and grubs equal to your proficiency bonus. A creature can use its action to eat up to 5 plants or grubs, each of which restores 1 hit point. A creature who eats at least 1 also recovers 1 level of fatigue, but can only benefit from this once per long rest. The plants and grubs die and spoil 1 hour after being collected.

optionalfeature.name: Forced Marcher
entries: The journeys your party undertake are reduced in length by 1 day, to a minimum of 1 day.

optionalfeature.name: Guide
entries: While traveling, when you would have a failure for a Scout journey activity, you succeed instead, and you can Scout in addition to engaging in any other journey activity.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Salves
entries: On a success or higher on a Harvest journey activity, you can collect natural ingredients and concoct an ointment that speeds healing. This salve is potent for 24 hours and has a number of uses equal to 1 + your Wisdom modifier. As an action, you can use the salve to restore {@dice 1d4} hit points to a creature within reach.

optionalfeature.name: Herbal Bitters
entries: On a success or higher on a Harvest journey activity, you can collect ingredients and brew two servings of a bitter drink that is potent for 24 hours. Imbibing a serving takes an action and reduces fatigue by one level for 4 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Huntsman
entries: You gain advantage on Gather Component journey activity checks.

optionalfeature.name: Longwalker
entries: When you would gain fatigue during a journey, you gain one fewer level of fatigue. Alternatively, you can choose to accept the level of fatigue, allowing up to two traveling companions to forgo gaining a level of fatigue instead. Once you have used this feature, you cannot do so again for a week.

optionalfeature.name: Master Tracker
entries: You can spend 5 minutes looking at a 30' diameter outdoor area to study the ground and other clues. You learn all events which transpired in that area in the last 24 hours as though you had witnessed them yourself, although you do not learn secret information not obvious to an observer. The information you gain is only that which would be learned by sight; you do not gain sound-based information or learn what creatures in the area said to each other.
Once you have used this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Monster Mimic
entries: By imitating how a beast or studied adversary sounds, looks, and moves, you gain advantage on Deception and Intimidation checks made to convince a creature that it is seeing or hearing that beast or studied adversary.

optionalfeature.name: Poisons and Antidotes
entries: After a Gather Components journey activity, you can extract 3 doses of liquid poison (when ingested, a creature makes a save or is {@condition poisoned|sns} for 1 hour) from poisonous plants you've foraged. Alternatively, using the same plants you can spend an hour making a dose of antitoxin.

optionalfeature.name: Read the Room
entries: By spending 10 minutes observing facial expressions, body language, and vocal intonation, you can detect minute details which give you insight into the creatures within 30' of you. For the next minute, you can direct your focus on any one creature that you can see within 30'. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower or doesn't speak any language, the creature is unaffected.
You learn the surface thoughts of the creature - what is most on its mind in that moment. As an action, you can shift your attention to another creature's thoughts.

optionalfeature.name: Relentless Pursuit
entries: Once you have successfully picked up the tracks of a creature, you are able to follow those tracks without any need for further checks for a period of up to 7 days.

optionalfeature.name: See the Unseen
entries: Once between long rests you can focus your attention on peripheral sights, sounds, and other signs of unseen passage. For the next hour, you can detect {@condition invisible|sns} creatures and objects, their location, movement, and actions, and even sense creatures and objects in the Ethereal Plane.

optionalfeature.name: Survivalist
entries: When traveling you may undertake two journey activities per day instead of one. Both activities must be from the following list: Befriend Creature, Gather Components, Harvest, Scout.
